attributes.action: Make Number10.gov.uk accountable to public demand
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I have not seen one petition on this site acted upon by the government - It appears to be yet another 'spin'.

I propose that on the 1st day of each month, the top 10 e-petitions are given a vote in Parliament, with the ruling party whip ordering their members to back the petition.

To prevent single issues clogging the system, any petition failing the parliamentary vote should be discarded for 6 months, thus making space for other leading petitions.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
